name: sftpupload
description: Usa SFTP para transferir archivos a un servidor remoto.
author: Oficina DevSecOps

inputs.name: sourceFolder
inputs.label: Source folder
inputs.helpMarkDown: The source folder of the files to copy to the remote machine.  When empty, the root of the repository (build) or artifacts directory (release) is used, which is $(System.DefaultWorkingDirectory).  Use variables if files are not in the repository. Example: $(Agent.BuildDirectory)

inputs.name: contents
inputs.label: Contents
inputs.helpMarkDown: File paths to include as part of the copy. Supports multiple lines of minimatch patterns.

inputs.name: targetFolder
inputs.label: Target folder
inputs.helpMarkDown: Target folder on the remote machine to where files will be copied. Example: /home/user/MySite, C:\inetpub\wwwroot\MySite.

inputs.name: host
inputs.label: Host name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Host name or IP address of the remote machine.

inputs.name: port
inputs.label: Port number
inputs.helpMarkDown: Port number on the remote machine to use for connecting.

inputs.name: password
inputs.label: Password
inputs.helpMarkDown: The password. An enviroment can be used in order to secure the password. Example: `$(mypassword)`

inputs.name: privatekey
inputs.label: Private key
inputs.helpMarkDown: The private key in OpenSSH format.

inputs.name: cleanTargetFolder
inputs.label: Clean target folder
inputs.helpMarkDown: Delete all existing files and subfolders in the target folder before copying.

inputs.name: failOnCleanError
inputs.label: Fail on clean errors
inputs.helpMarkDown: Fail if there is an error while cleaning the target folder. Only applies when Clean target folder is true.

inputs.name: overwrite
inputs.label: Overwrite
inputs.helpMarkDown: Replace existing files in and beneath the target folder.

inputs.name: failOnEmptySource
inputs.label: Fail if no files found to copy
inputs.helpMarkDown: Fail if no matching files to be copied are found under the source folder.

inputs.name: flattenFolders
inputs.label: Flatten folders
inputs.helpMarkDown: Flatten the folder structure and copy all files into the specified target folder on the remote machine.
